{"id":553842494,"lang":"python","lang_name":"Python","time":"1 year, 10 months","timestamp":1631480269,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"93 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/553842494/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Remove Duplicates from Sorted Array","memory":"14.7 MB","code":"class Solution(object):\n    def removeDuplicates(self, nums):\n        \"\"\"\n        :type nums: List[int]\n        :rtype: int\n        \"\"\"\n        if len(nums) == 0: return 0\n        if len(nums) == 1: return 1\n        \n        # nums = [0,0,1,1,1,2,2,3,3,4]\n        j = 1 # slover pointer, only move when meet unique number\n        for i in range(1, len(nums)): # faster pointer, i will iterate over all element in nums\n            if nums[i] != nums[i-1]: # when nums[i] is a unique number, assign it to nums[j]\n                nums[j] = nums[i]\n                j += 1\n        # After for loop, i = 9, j = 5, nums = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 2, 2, 3, 3, 4]\n        # We have to delete duplicates backwards\n        for delete_index in range(i, j-1, -1):\n            del nums[delete_index]\n\n        return j","compare_result":"","title_slug":"remove-duplicates-from-sorted-array","has_notes":false}
